com.bmd.jrt.android.v4.routine

Class JRoutine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bmd.jrt.routine.JRoutine
      • com.bmd.jrt.android.v4.routine.JRoutine

  • public class JRoutine
extends JRoutine
    This utility class extends the base Java routine in order to support additional routine builders specific to the Android platform.

    For example, in order to get a resource from the network, needed to fill an activity UI: 

         

         @Override
         protected void onCreate(final Bundle savedInstanceState) {

             super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
             setContentView(R.layout.my_activity_layout);

             JRoutine.initContext(this);

             if (savedInstanceState != null) {

                 mResource = savedInstanceState.getParcelable(RESOURCE_KEY);
             }

             if (mResource != null) {

                 displayResource(mResource);

             } else {

                 final Routine<URI, MyResource> routine =
                         JRoutine.from(this, ClassToken.tokenOf(LoadResource.class))
                                 .buildRoutine();
                 routine.callAsync(RESOURCE_URI)
                        .bind(new TemplateOutputConsumer<MyResource>() {

                            @Override
                            public void onError(@Nullable final Throwable error) {

                                displayError(error);
                            }

                            @Override
                            public void onOutput(final MyResource resource) {

                                mResource = resource;
                                displayResource(resource);
                            }
                        });
             }
         }

         @Override
         protected void onSaveInstanceState(final Bundle outState) {

             super.onSaveInstanceState(outState);
             outState.putParcelable(RESOURCE_KEY, mResource);
         }
    The above code will ensure that the loading process survives any configuration change and the resulting resource is dispatched only once.

    Created by davide on 12/8/14.

    • Method Detail

      • from

        @Nonnull
public static <INPUT,OUTPUT> AndroidRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT> from(@Nonnull
                                                              Fragment fragment,
                                                              @Nonnull
                                                              ClassToken<? extends Invocation<INPUT,OUTPUT>> classToken)
        Returns a builder of routines linked to the specified context.

        Note that, waiting for the outputs of the built routine immediately after its invocation on the main thread, will result in a deadlock. In fact the routine results will be always dispatched in the main UI thread.

        Type Parameters:
        INPUT - the input data type.
        OUTPUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment instance.
        classToken - the invocation class token.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the specified activity is not initialized.
        NullPointerException - if any of the specified parameters is null.

      • from

        @Nonnull
public static <INPUT,OUTPUT> AndroidRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT> from(@Nonnull
                                                              FragmentActivity activity,
                                                              @Nonnull
                                                              ClassToken<? extends Invocation<INPUT,OUTPUT>> classToken)
        Returns a builder of routines linked to the specified context.

        Note that, waiting for the outputs of the built routine immediately after its invocation on the main thread, will result in a deadlock. In fact the routine results will be always dispatched in the main UI thread.

        Type Parameters:
        INPUT - the input data type.
        OUTPUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity instance.
        classToken - the invocation class token.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the specified activity is not initialized.
        NullPointerException - if any of the specified parameters is null.

      • initContext

        public static void initContext(@Nonnull
               Fragment fragment)
        Initializes the specified context so to enable the creation of routines linked to the context lifecycle.
        This method must be called in the fragment onCreate() method.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified fragment is null.
